p_0fZsbZLXD1_nOW-ILGHQ.text: Let's just say that I am a very picky eater when it comes to Vietnamese food. But I was absolutely amazed at the food quality at Cay Tre.We ordered Banh Cuon (the rice pancake with pork and beef filling) as appetizer and it was fantastic. And as a Vietnamese I find it very authentic. For the main dish we had Braised Catfish in a Claypot and Bun Bo Hue. Bun Bo Hue is a childhood dish for me, and I can understand how hard it is to perfect it. But Cay Tre was definitely that close to perfection. I would certainly go here again, and this time for newer dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Cay Tre - London, United Kingdom. Catfish in a clay pot. With egg fried rice.
Photo of Cay Tre - London, United Kingdom. Amazing Bun Bo Hue. The texture and the taste. It was very very authentic. And this is coming from a Vietnamese.
Photo of Cay Tre - London, United Kingdom. Banh Cuon. Rice pancake.

_iLeqU8BmWx-jsi_rzSwog.text: I'm from LA and Vietnamese so trust when I say the food is surprisingly acceptable for London foodies. It's not the most authentic but good enough to get your Vietnamese fix. I had the Vietnamese crepe it was good but the pho is as close to authentic as you are going to get. DO try the pho!

M1aHt581J8MMh2NneK-Bmw.text: Dropped in here for a pre-theater dinner and judging by the reviews on Yelp, I thought that it wasn't too bad price wise or taste wise. As there was a few of us, we opted for the set menu which was £23 pp and included a sharing platter for starters and for the main course 1 dish and a side per person. The sharing platter consisted of Pork Spring rolls, Chilli Salt and Pepper Squid and Wild Shrimp Fresh Rolls & Cha La Lot. When we enquired if there was any beef in the starters, we were told that the Cha La Lot had beef in it, however the restaurant were very accommodating and changed it to Vegetarian Spring rolls instead. For mains, the waiter recommended 2 rices and a veg so we opted for one Jasmine Rice and one Egg Fried Rice as well as Chouchou - a fruit we were told. I had the Sizzling seafood which consisted of prawns, squid and mussels, one of my companions the Saigon Stewed Pork Belly and the other Duck with Green Peppercorn. All dishes were nice however the size of the rice portions were MASSIVE!! We definitely did not need 2 portions of rice between 3 of us! Only half of the Egg Fried Rice got eaten and the Jasmine rice was picked at. They were tasty and Chouchou is.... interesting.Overall the place was okay. It took ages for the waiter to actually come and take our order and then when we tried to get the waiter to come over again to ask for more water, he said sorry someone else will come, to which someone else did but then they referred us over to someone else and this was just frustrating after a while - especially when we had to go to the theatre after! I'm not sure I would come back but I did enjoy it. In hindsight, I should have maybe tried the Pho instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Cay Tre - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cay Tre - London, United Kingdom. Rice noodles Spring rolls
Photo of Cay Tre - London, United Kingdom. Selection of startera

Q90LJJ0uvd9NaEGgp19H2g.text: For central London, this place is pretty delicious. I've only had the Saigon pho, but it was everything I could've asked for in a bowl of pho. It was warm, aromatic, and flavorful. They have a decent selection of different foods from their menu so I definitely plan on coming back to try something else. We came here on a Saturday night and it was very busy, so I would recommend coming early or booking. I thought the service was good as well. Our server was Vietnamese too which is always a plus when you're eating at a Vietnamese restaurant!

MfBSgpANDjiHnpeiwF5MWg.text: Came here for lunch and decided to try the bun bo hue instead of pho.   Traditional pho Restos have a distinct anise scent.   The broth should permeate the restaurant.   Unfortunately this place did not so I decided to skip on the pho.   I ordered bun bo hue ( hue spicy beef soup) and was highly disappointed.  The broth lacked depth of flavor and lemongrass.   The meats were mostly small chunks and overall flavorless.  The shrimp spring rolls were good.  I wouldn't come back.  For westerners, this may be acceptable but for anyone with any type of traditional Vietnamese palate, I'd skip this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Cay Tre - London, United Kingdom. Spring rolls were nice and chewy.
Photo of Cay Tre - London, United Kingdom. Bun bo hue.  Flavorless.   Notice the lack of rau ram.  Barely any meat and little lemongrass.

nTufkWISOfOFHszRxSZ4dQ.text: Have been making the rounds of all the Soho pho places having become tired and disappointed with Pho (the restaurant).  This place definitely wins for best tasting pho and probably largest serving as well.  Really flavorful broth.  That said, it is too expensive to become a lunchtime regular (£8.50 for pho ga).  However, the prices are the same at lunch as for dinner, so I'm looking forward to trying this place after work with friends and trying more than just their pho.

yVlw1dri2n3uWXqTrqsz1g.text: Amazing food, service lacking but still good place to go

RgEA76TWmk9eZ3_f1OzbtA.text: really good starters incl in the set menu but the service is f***ing shit and the main was ok, but nothing special

W9z1v1wI3K7rRYw0Ws2Lug.text: Crap service, but delicious food. BE CAREFUL IF YOU EAT HERE. (See my note below). We went there on a Sunday afternoon. Service was chaos from the moment we stepped in the door. The maitre D told us that it would be a 5 minute wait, proceeded to give our table to a group of 3 who were there before us that he had forgotten about, and then came over again to ask us how many we were, as if we had just walked in the door and he was seeing us for the first time. Once we were finally seated, we waited about 15 minutes before asking for a waiter since no one could be bothered to come to our table. The food was delicious. We had vietnamese rolls, yummy cha lo lot (pork stuffed in some herbs), and an assortment of noodles. If the food wasn't so good, I would have given the restaurant 1 star because the service was so atrocious. 1 of the 4 main courses we ordered came 10 minutes after the others. And it only came after we asked for it. Here is the worst part: once we flagged someone down to bring us the bill (and again, this took ages), we asked the bill to be split in half. The waitress proceeded to divide the bill in two and then ROUND UP EACH HALF! I couldnt tell if she just didnt know how to do simple basic maths (in which case she should not be working there), or if she was taking the piss. BE CAREFUL IF YOU EAT HERE. I dont know if this is standard policy at this restaurant, but tip of 12.5% (which they did NOT deserve) was already added onand the audacity to round up our bill? I told her it was no different than taking the extra pound straight out of my pocket. I dont know if that registered at all, or if she even cared. It is too bad that no one resembling management could be found when we left, otherwise they would have received an earful from meabout the poor overall service and the trick they tried to pull at the end with our bill. What a shame about the service, since the food was delicious. As others have said, there are plenty of other places to spend your money. Go to this restaurant at your peril.
